block.p: ABC News is revamping the executive structure of its newsmagazine division amid a general decline in ratings for the magazine-style programs at all of the major broadcast networks.
This fall, ABC, a unit of the Walt Disney Company, will put new executive producers in charge of ''20/20 Downtown,'' ''Prime Time Live Thursday'' and the Friday edition of ''20/20.''
ABC News is revamping the executive structure of its newsmagazine division amid a general decline in ratings for the magazine-style programs at all of the major broadcast networks.
This fall, ABC, a unit of the Walt Disney Company, will put new executive producers in charge of ''20/20 Downtown,'' ''Prime Time Live Thursday'' and the Friday edition of ''20/20.''

For the last two years, all of ABC's prime-time newsmagazines have been controlled by Victor Neufeld. He is being named senior executive producer of ABC News prime-time magazines and will have general oversight of the programs.
The new executive producers will report to him but will have individual control of their programs.

Executives said that David Sloan, the senior producer of ''20/20 Downtown,'' would become the executive producer of ''20/20 Friday.'' ''Downtown'' is the only ABC news program that has had a significant rise in ratings this season. Executive producers are still being sought for the other two programs.
Executives said the change was intended to make the programs more distinctive and less reliant on formulaic stories and sensationalism.
Though some inside ABC said Mr. Neufeld's role would be somewhat diminished, he said he supported the changes.
''The way to go is not to make generic newsmagazines, but to create distinctive programs,'' he said.
